item.title: Accessing a Windows SMB Share on Ubuntu
item.description: Install Packages Make sure your packages with sudo apt update Install the Samba Package, the SMB Client package, and the CIFS Utilities package The Samba package allows Ubuntu machines to share Windows resources SMB Client is a set of command line tools that allows Ubuntu to access Server Message Block (SMB)/Common Internet File System (CIFS) resources CIFS-Utils allows mounting SMB and CIFS file systems to an Ubuntu system sudo apt install samba smbclient cifs-utils Mount Directly in Ubuntu’s File Explorer Open File Explorer Click ‘Other Locations’ Enter the following in the Connect to Server text box: `smb://SHARE-IP-ADDRESS/NAME-OF-SHARE Mount to a directory using Terminal Open the terminal Create a directory in the /mnt folder to mount the drive to mkdir /mnt/share Then mount the drive to that newly created directory sudo mount -t cifs //IP_ADDRESS_OF_SHARE/SHARE_NAME /mnt/share -o username=YOUR_USERNAME,password=YOUR_PASSWORD,uid=$(id -u),gid=$(id -g) (Optional) In the terminal, open the fstab file sudo nano //etc/fstab (Optional) Add the following line to the fstab file to make sure your share automatically mounts on restart \pard\pardeftab720\partightenfactor0 \cf2 //IP-address-of-share/share-name /mnt/share cifs username=your-username,password=your-password,uid=1000,gid=1000 0 0\
